owl:Ontology.dc:title: EEPSA (Energy Efficiency Prediction Semantic Assistant) Ontology
owl:Ontology.terms:creator: Iker Esnaola-Gonzalez <mailto:iker.esnaola@tekniker.es> Jesús Bermúdez <mailto:jesus.bermudez@ehu.eus>
owl:Ontology.terms:license: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: A location not provided by geo-coordinates (i.e. building A, city of Aarhus).
The WGS84 altitude of a SpatialThing (decimal meters above the local reference ellipsoid).
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: altitude

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: The WGS84 latitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: latitude

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: The WGS84 longitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: longitude

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an Observation and the Spatial Thing (Building, Space) where it has been captured
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: captured in

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Spatial Thing (Building, Space) and the Observation that has been captured
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: captures

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation used to assign Building Element to a certain Spatial Structure (Space or Building).
A relation between a physical space and the objects located in such space.
Relation between a Thing and a data source where values can be retrieved.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has data source

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between a Thing (mainly an Outlier) and a Method proposed to solve it
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has solving method

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the period to which it is exposed to sun
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sun exposure period

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Thing (Sensor) and a Unit of measurement
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has unit of measure

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a space and the Quantity Kind that is affects its indoor conditions
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is affected by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between an object and the physical space in which it is located.
A relation between a Building Element and the Spatial Structure (Space or Building) in which it is contained
Relationship between a space and the Quantity Kind that is affects its indoor conditions with a higher degree
Relation between a Weather Station and the Weather Service it provides (weather report, weather forecast,...)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: provides weather service

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the cause that makes a sensing devices susceptible to suffer from Outliers.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: susceptible to outliers caused by

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the Ending Time of a temporal entity.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: ending time

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the manufacturer of a Thing
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: manufactured by

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Model of a Thing (normally a Physical Object)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: model

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the Date (e.g. yyyy-MM-dd) of an observation.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: observation date

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the Time (e.g. hh:mm:ss) of an observation.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: observation time

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the Starting time of a temporal entity.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: starting time

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A method is a Description that defines or uses concepts in order to guide carrying out actions aimed at a solution with respect to a problem. It is different from a Plan, because plans could be carried out in order to follow a method, but a method can be followed by executing alternative plans.

Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e.
spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT), lat(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT).
sameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).
A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: point

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space in contact with the exterior by means of at least one building element.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Adjacent to Outdoor Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space with bad insulation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bad Insulated Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space located in a storey below ground.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Below Ground Level Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Actuator used to put the blinds up or down

A method that consists in placing the sensing device in an adequate location. Following guides can be followed:
https://www.rmets.org/sites/default/files/pdf/guidelines/aws-guide.pdf
http://weatherfaqs.org.uk/node/124
http://www.conservationphysics.org/datalog/datlog6.php
http://www.weatherstations.co.uk/gooddata.htm
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Device Relocation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A method that consists in covering the sensing device adequately to avoid erroneous observations. For example, Stevenson Screen to shield the sensing device against direct precipitation or direct sunlight.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Device Shelter

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the East
owl:Class.rdfs:label: East Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: HVAC actuator for cooling or heating
Actuator used to turn the lights on or off.
Meteorological Variables that can be measured by weather stations (this means that they are outdoors. Maybe the name has to be changed)
A space enlightened with a source of light from the exterior (and not enlightened by a source of light inside the space).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Naturally Enlightened Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the North East
owl:Class.rdfs:label: North East Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the North
owl:Class.rdfs:label: North Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the North West
owl:Class.rdfs:label: North West Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Observations that stand out and do not conform to the expected behaviour
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An erroneous observation (e.g. temperature, illuminance) caused by a beam spotlight. For example, an observation made by a sensing device located under a light bulb
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by Beam Spotlight

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Outliers caused by an error on the device itself
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by Device Error

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Outlier caused by the poor location of the device
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by Device Location

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An erroneous observation caused by the low battery of the device.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by Device Low Battery

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An erroneous observation caused by a malfunction suffered by the device, which might have been transient.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by Device Malfunction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An erroneous observation (e.g. temperature, illuminance) caused by external factors. For example for being next to a source of radiant heat or cold such as windows and poorly insulated outside walls.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by External Conditions

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An erroneous observation (e.g. temperature) caused by its placement next to an activated HVAC system (whether it was heating or cooling)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by HVAC

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An erroneous observation caused by rainfall.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by Rain

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An erroneous observation (e.g. temperature, illuminance) caused by direct sunlight.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlier caused by Solar Radiation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A device that is sheltered
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sheltered Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the South East
owl:Class.rdfs:label: South East Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the South
owl:Class.rdfs:label: South Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the South West
owl:Class.rdfs:label: South West Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Predicted meteorological conditions for an area
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Weather Forecasting

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A summary of weather conditions for an area
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Weather Report

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the West
owl:Class.rdfs:label: West Oriented Object

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Individual representing sun exposure period in April for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in April for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in April for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in April for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in August for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in August for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in August for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in August for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in December for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in December for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in December for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in February for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in February for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in February for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in February for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in January for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in January for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in January for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in July for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in July for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in July for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in July for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in June for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in June for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in June for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in June for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in March for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in March for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in March for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in March for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in May for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in May for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in May for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in May for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in November for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in November for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in November for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in October for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in October for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in October for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in October for objects oriented towards the South West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in September for objects oriented towards the North East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in September for objects oriented towards the North West.
Individual representing sun exposure period in September for objects oriented towards the South East.
Individual representing sun exposure period in September for objects oriented towards the South West.

rdf:Description.dc:description: A vocabulary for representing latitude, longitude and altitude information in the WGS84 geodetic reference datum. Version $Id: wgs84_pos.rdf,v 1.22 2009/04/20 15:00:30 timbl Exp $. See http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/ for more details.
rdf:Description.dc:title: WGS84 Geo Positioning: an RDF vocabulary
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Recent changes to this namespace: $Log: wgs84_pos.rdf,v $ Revision 1.22 2009/04/20 15:00:30 timbl Remove the time bits which have been deal with elsewhere eg in iCal.
Revision 1.21 2009/04/20 12:52:47 timbl try again
Revision 1.20 2009/04/20 12:42:11 timbl Add Event (edited ages ago and never checked in), and location (following discussion http://chatlogs.planetrdf.com/swig/2009-04-20#T12-36-09)
Revision 1.19 2009/04/20 12:36:31 timbl Add Event (edited ages ago and never checked in), and location (following discussion http://chatlogs.planetrdf.com/swig/2009-04-20#T12-36-09)
Revision 1.18 2006/02/01 22:01:04 danbri Clarified that lat and long are decimal degrees, and that alt is decimal metres about local reference ellipsoid
Revision 1.17 2004/02/06 17:38:12 danbri Fixed a bad commit screwup
Revision 1.15 2003/04/19 11:24:08 danbri Fixed the typo even more.
Revision 1.14 2003/04/19 11:16:56 danbri fixed a typo
Revision 1.13 2003/02/19 22:27:27 connolly relaxed domain constraints on lat/long/alt from Point to SpatialThing
Revision 1.12 2003/01/12 01:41:41 danbri Trying local copy of XSLT doc.
Revision 1.11 2003/01/12 01:20:18 danbri added a link to morten's xslt rdfs viewer.
Revision 1.10 2003/01/11 18:56:49 danbri Removed datatype range from lat and long properties, since they would have required each occurance of the property to mention the datatype.
Revision 1.9 2003/01/11 11:41:31 danbri Another typo; repaired rdfs:Property to rdf:Property x4
Revision 1.8 2003/01/11 11:05:02 danbri Added an rdfs:range for each lat/long/alt property, http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float
Revision 1.7 2003/01/10 20:25:16 danbri Longer rdfs:comment for Point, trying to be Earth-centric and neutral about coordinate system(s) at the same time. Feedback welcomed.
Revision 1.6 2003/01/10 20:18:30 danbri Added CVS log comments into the RDF/XML as an rdfs:comment property of the vocabulary. Note that this is not common practice (but seems both harmless and potentially useful).
revision 1.5 date: 2003/01/10 20:14:31; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +16 -5 Updated schema: Added a dc:date, added url for more info. Changed the rdfs:label of the namespace from gp to geo. Added a class Point, set as the rdfs:domain of each property. Added XML comment on the lat_long property suggesting that we might not need it (based on #rdfig commentary from implementors).
revision 1.4 date: 2003/01/10 20:01:07; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +6 -5 Fixed typo; several rdfs:about attributes are now rdf:about. Thanks to MortenF in #rdfig for catching this error.
revision 1.3 date: 2003/01/10 11:59:03; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +4 -3 fixed buglet in vocab, added more wgs links
revision 1.2 date: 2003/01/10 11:01:11; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +4 -4 Removed alt from the as-a-flat-string property, and switched from space separated to comma separated.
revision 1.1 date: 2003/01/10 10:53:23; author: danbri; state: Exp; basic geo vocab
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: geo

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A comma-separated representation of a latitude, longitude coordinate.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lat/long
